channel.title: fsl on NeuroSnippets
channel.description: Recent content in fsl on NeuroSnippets

item.title: Grind those brains! Diffusion MRI preprocessing with papermill
item.description: Notebooks: you love them or you hate them Notebooks are an interesting beast: they have become extremely diverse and popular, everyone loves them, from declared non-programmers to enthusiastic pythonistas, from Kaggle fans to scientists. Well, that’s not exactly true: notebooks are actually one of those things that you end up loving them or strongly feeling against them - with indifference being very rare and usually due to not having interacted with them a lot.

item.title: One container to rule them all: FSL-FIX in a box
item.description: “Use a container” is the new “You need a virtual machine” I have to be sincere: the first time I heard about containers I was not impressed. It sounded like an exotic approach, and I couldn’t see why would you need that. A few years later, I have changed my mind a lot about it: not only containers can be used to create reproducible workflows, but they are also useful in several applications (taken to the extreme in some cases).
